author: Special Correspondent
text:
Will be held in two categories, for seniors and juniors

The stage is set for The Hindu Young World Painting Competition 2016 for Puducherry region to be held here on Sunday.

The competition, being organised in association with Thyrocare, is for two categories---juniors (Classes IV to VI) and seniors (Classes VII to IX).

The event will be held at the Sri Sankara Vidyalaya Matriculation HSS on ECR Road, Puducherry 605008.

Registrations commence at 9 a.m. and the competition will begin at 9.30 a.m.

The selected students who have been informed need to come to the venue at their own cost.

For the event, the use of sketch pens and marker pens are to be avoided. Paper will be given by the organisers. The topic will be announced at the venue.

The jury’s decision will be final and the paintings become the sole property of The Hindu and will not be returned.

The prize distribution will take place at 1 p.m. the same day. Apart from the first, second and third prizes, there will be a number of consolation prizes. All participants will receive a Participation Certificate. For further details, contact N. Hariharan on 9789069672.

S. Maran, founder-managing director of Jeno Maran Builders, Puducherry, is the chief guest for the event. Sri Sankara Vidyalaya MHSS is the venue partner and Triumphant Institute of Management Education Private Ltd (T.I.M.E) is the snack partner.
title: The Hindu Young World painting competition tomorrow
